pr_title: Exclude base products from PAYG (Pay-As-You-Go) instances when feeding the subscription matcher

timeline.message: Update changelog for spacewalk-java

timeline.bodyHTML:
Hmm, We need to check if a PAYG subscription really obsolete all subscriptions.
I could imagin that we do not need a SLES subscription, but what about a SUSE Manager Lifecycle Subscription?
@joesusecom ?
timeline.author: mcalmer

replies.bodyText:
CC @hustodemon @moio
I talked to @BLandorff and this is a problem. None of the Payg instances has SUSE Manager Lifecycle Subscription included. If we would just remove them from the list we would do something wrong.
I think we should list the system, but without "product ids". When we prepare the Json for the matcher we just add the Lifecycle product ids.
Could this work?
replies.author: mcalmer

replies.bodyText: I've pushed the changes needed here.
replies.author: meaksh

timeline.body: Nit: this null-check could be avoided if you used a primitive `boolean` attribute on L42 (not the boxed `Boolean`).
timeline.bodyText: Nit: this null-check could be avoided if you used a primitive boolean attribute on L42 (not the boxed Boolean).
timeline.bodyHTML: Nit: this null-check could be avoided if you used a primitive boolean attribute on L42 (not the boxed Boolean).
timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.body: This method is called for each guest on a salt-based virtualization host, when the virtualization beacon fires. Doesn't this "truncate" `payg` flags  of all hosts to `false`?
timeline.bodyText: This method is called for each guest on a salt-based virtualization host, when the virtualization beacon fires. Doesn't this "truncate" payg flags  of all hosts to false?
timeline.bodyHTML: This method is called for each guest on a salt-based virtualization host, when the virtualization beacon fires. Doesn't this "truncate" payg flags of all hosts to false?
timeline.author: hustodemon
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -317,6 +374,27 @@ public static void updateGuestVirtualInstance(VirtualInstance virtualInstance,
     public static void updateGuestVirtualInstance(VirtualInstance virtualInstance,

replies.bodyText:
The PAYG attribute could only be true for Public Cloud instances (which can be PAYG or BYOS).
In case of a private cloud, all instances should be BYOS, therefore payg is set to false.
replies.author: meaksh

timeline.message: Adapt jUnit test to take care of entitlements

timeline.bodyHTML:
Nitpick:

Suggested change
public void setPayg(boolean isPAYG) {
public void setPayg(boolean paygIn) {
timeline.author: moio

timeline.body: @hustodemon this means that those systems will get no product rather than free products from the matcher's POV. Are you explicitly OK with that?
timeline.bodyText: @hustodemon this means that those systems will get no product rather than free products from the matcher's POV. Are you explicitly OK with that?
timeline.bodyHTML: @hustodemon this means that those systems will get no product rather than free products from the matcher's POV. Are you explicitly OK with that?
timeline.author: moio

replies.bodyText: We had a discussion the other day together with @mcalmer and @hustodemon, and the conclusion was: for PAYG instances we only want to report the "SUMA Lifecycle" subscription and also the "Monitoring" one if that's the case. We're excluding all base installed products.
replies.author: meaksh

replies.bodyText: Exactly, only the manager-related subscriptions (lifecycle + monitoring). That should be the goal.
replies.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
*
